query.result:
| Italian | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | ahi | Germanic | *ai* | | anima | Latin | anima | | ingannare | Latin | in+gannare | | e | Latin | et | | fattura | Latin | factura | | empio | Latin | impius | | che | Latin | quod | | da | Latin | de | | sì | Latin | sic | | fare | Latin | facere | | bene | Latin | bene | | torcere | Latin | torquere | | il | Latin | ille | | cuore | Latin | cor | | drizzare | Latin | directus | | in | Latin | in | | vanità | Latin | vanitas | | il | Latin | ille | | vostro | Latin | vester | | tempia | Latin | tempora |
**Note:**
* The etymology of "ahi" is uncertain, but it is thought to be of Germanic origin. * The etymology of "ingannare" is from the Latin "in" (in) and "gannare" (to deceive). * The etymology of "fattura" is from the Latin "factura" (making, workmanship). * The etymology of "empio" is from the Latin "impius" (ungodly, wicked). * The etymology of "drizzare" is from the Latin "directus" (straight, direct).
